entry.title: PG Etexts
entry.content:
Some PG E-texts I helped proofread.

http://gutenberg.net/1/2/8/4/12846/12846.txt
http://www.gutenberg.net/1/2/8/5/12852/12852-h/12852-h.htm
http://www.gutenberg.net/1/2/8/6/12863/12863-h/12863-h.htm
http://www.gutenberg.net/1/2/8/7/12871/12871-h/12871-h.htm
http://www.gutenberg.net/1/2/8/6/12861/12861-h/12861-h.htm
http://www.gutenberg.net/1/2/9/0/12903/12903-h/12903-h.htm

PARENTAL
ADVISORY
JIMREGAN CONTAINS
EXPLICIT LYRICS

Username:

From Go-Quiz.com

How to make a jimregan
Ingredients:

1 part friendliness

5 parts ambition

5 parts empathy
Method:
Stir together in a glass tumbler with a salted rim. Add sadness to taste! Do not overindulge!


Username:


Personality cocktail
From Go-Quiz.com

entry.title: More Good Omens quotes/Messing around with RDF
entry.content:
More Good Omens quotes

DON'T THINK OF IT AS DYING, said Death, JUST THINK OF IT AS LEAVING EARLY TO AVOID THE RUSH.
%
"It was state of the art, he said.
"The art in this case was probably pottery."
%
"The small alien walked past the car.
'"C02 level up 0.5 percent," it rasped, giving him a meaningful look. "You do know you could find yourself charged with being a dominant species while under the influence of impulse-driven consumerism, don't you?"'
%
"[T]he standard computer warranty agreement which said that if the machine 1) didn't work, 2) didn't do what the expensive advertisements said, 3) electrocuted the immediate neighborhood, 4) and in fact failed entirely to be inside the expensive box when you opened it, this was expressly, absolutely, implicitly and in no event the fault or responsibility of the manufacturer, that the purchaser should consider himself lucky to be allowed to give his money to the manufacturer, and that any attempt to treat what had just been paid for as the purchaser's own property would result in the attentions of serious men with menacing briefcases and very thin watches. Crowley had been extremely impressed with the warranties offered by the computer industry, and had in fact sent a bundle Below to the department that drew up the Immortal Soul agreements, with a yellow memo form attached just saying: 'Learn, guys . . .'"

Been messing around with different bits of RDF recently.



RDF and the Semantic Web looks pretty cool to me. I have to admit, I've fallen for the vision of the future that the W3C have spun.



Taking calendars as an example: even though most of us can use iCalendar files, I don't think too many have started using them for much, but since RDF has the sort of bleeding edge coolness attached to it, simple 1:1 translations will probably be picked up, just because developers will add those features to be buzzword compliant.




sample ical 1

An iCalendar file of my work timetable:

entry.title: Yay! More dumb tests.
entry.content:
Which OS are You?


Which Nigerian spammer are You?

entry.title: Good Omens.
entry.content:
Brilliant.



"They'd been brought up to it and weren't, when you got right down to it, particularly evil. Human beings mostly aren't. They just get carried away by new ideas, like dressing up in jackboots and shooting people, or dressing up in white sheets and lynching people, or dressing up in tie-dye jeans and playing guitars at people."

"Anathema tried every method of search she could think of. There was the methodical quartering of the ground. There was the slapdash poking at the bracken by the roadside. There was the nonchalant sidling up to it and looking out of the side of her eye. She even tried the one which every romantic nerve in her body insisted should work, which consisted of theatrically giving up, sitting down, and letting her glance fall naturally on a patch of earth which, if she had been in any decent narrative, should have contained the book."

"That was the trouble. Witchfinders didn't get paid by the hour. Any witchfinder who spent a week examining the local crones and then told the mayor, 'Well done, not a pointy hat among the lot of them,' would get fulsome thanks, a bowl of soup and a meaningful goodbye.

"So in order to turn a profit Hopkins had to find a remarkable number of witches. This made him more than a little unpopular with the village councils, and he was himself hanged as a witch by an East Anglian village who had sensibly realized that they could cut their overheads by eliminating the middleman."

"He'd never met Agnes. She was too bright, obviously. Normally Heaven or Hell spotted the prophetic types and broadcast enough noises on the same mental channel to prevent any undue accuracy. Actually that was rarely necessary; they normally found ways of generating their own static in self-defense against the images that echoed around their heads."

entry.title: Mark got sorted.
entry.content:
Oh, he had to be sorted too:



be sorted @ nimbo.net

May as well put this in while I'm at it.

Mark just took the robot test:



Which Colossal Death Robot Are You?
Brought to you by Rum and Monkey

entry.title: RSS Scraper
entry.content:
Playing around with RSSscraper. Pretty cool, once I figured out I was missing a couple of spaces in the regex. Here's a sample scraper for Ben Okopnik's blog. 

class BenScanner < RSSscraper::AbstractScanner
    def initialize
        @url_string = 'http://okopnik.freeshell.org/blog/blog.cgi'
        @url_proper = 'http://okopnik.freeshell.org/blog/'
        @postsRE = /div class="HeadText"> \n\n([^<]*)\n\n<\/div>\n<\/td>\n<\/tr>\n\n<tr>\n<td bgcolor="#fdfded" class="UsualText" valign="middle">  \n\n<br><b>([^<]*)<\/b><p>\n\n([^\]]*)\n\n<p>\[ <a href="([^\s\t\r\n\f]*)">([^<]*)<\/a>/m
    end

    def find_items
        require 'cgi'
        items = Array.new
         request_feed.scan(@postsRE).each{ |date, title, content, comments_link, comments|
                        items << { :title => title,
                                   :description => "#{CGI::escapeHTML(content)}",
                                   :comments_link => @url_proper+comments_link,
                                   :comments => @url_proper+comments_link,
                                 }
        }
        items
    end
end

class Ben < RSSscraper::AbstractScraper

    def scanner
        BenScanner.new
    end

    def description
    {
        :link => 'http://okopnik.freeshell.org/blog/blog.cgi',
        :title => 'The Bay of Tranquility',
        :description => 'Ben Okopnik\'s blog.',
        :language => 'en-us',
        :generator => generator_string
    }    
    end

end

entry.title: Completely scientific name analysis
entry.content:
The Weekly / Your Name Here / Your Name Deciphered



Literal meaning
"Like a panther, a sleek, crouching panther. In fact, it is a panther. Jesus! No, wait, it's just some panther; I'm looking the wrong way."


History
Taken from the English for "Jimmy" under appalling conditions, the name Jimmy was originally used ineffectually to refer to the Disney corporation, its subsidiaries and partners, before being mispronounced by a registering officer.

Famous Jimmys
1. Lady The Miss Jimmy Grating, indifferent to demanding money with menaces;
2. Jimmy Thews, belittler of the evaporating duck;
3. Jimmy Frewsy, early user of a popular music band made entirely of soap; ghost-writer of Lionel Stander's shatteringly political autobiography, YES, I THOUGHT I WAS DEAD TOO;
4. Jimmy Y du Dindymene, channeller under supernatural influences of quiffs; ghost-writer of Reg Parfitt's anarchist's handbook and autobiography, READ MY STORY IN THIS BOOK;
5. Jimmy W O'Boonk-Macaulay, co-writer of INDIANA JONES AND THE FIRST ON THE RIGHT; first holder of the bewilderingly ritualistic office of Chancellor of the Eggs Checker;
6. Brigadier-General Jimmy de Marl-Tidecatcher, MSc, director of the new Bond movie, SINISTER DEATH;
7. Jimmy N G Toot, who lost a fortune on quicklime dental cleanser;
8. Chief Scientist Jimmy de Dots ("The Thing"), who's never forgotten the Brass Nose;
9. "Terrible" Jimmy O'Proms, aroused by the self-propelled gardener;
10. Doctor Jimmy d'Oily, once saved by the self-aware cartoon strip.

Typical Jimmy motto
"The song of a single bird can be louder than the thunder of a thousand ants."

and:

Literal meaning
"Decoy."


History

Killing thirty-two and withering all crops for a mile when first read out from a newly discovered sliver of parchment around 11am, the name Jimmy was originally used penetratingly to refer to the dead, before being modified genetically by scientists.



Famous Jimmys

1. Jimmy M Nivea, once saved by Elvis impersonator impersonators;
2. Jimmy Sponetote-Dindymene, who's never forgotten the hovering cinema; last holder of the office of Police-constable;
3. Jimmy H Tightbadger, MD, DSO and Bar, who discovered the definitive manual on drowning;
4. Chief Scientist Jimmy Grating-Marl, of the generation which fondly remembers Evap-o-Floor;
5. Jimmy Dots, director of the new Bond movie, SILVERY DEATH-DOOM;
6. Jimmy Nootlooter, champion of bungee-jumping;
7. Jimmy Frote, PhD, who owes everything to the world's sturdiest box;
8. Jimmy de S'Ess, co-habitee of five people associated with the early career of Roy Clarke;
9. Jimmy Trabmaw ("The Uncanny"), first victim of the concept of acceptable losses;
10. I Am Jimmy Macaulay ("The Mighty"), populariser of quiffs; ghost-writer of Ming the Merciless's religious handbook and autobiography, REMINISCING FROM MY DEATHBED.



Typical Jimmy motto

"Hahaha! That was funny."

entry.title: Oh, the stupidity...
entry.content:
be sorted @ nimbo.net


Which Colossal Death Robot Are You?
Brought to you by Rum and Monkey


Are You Damned?
Brought to you by Rum and Monkey


Which Office Moron Are You?
Rum and Monkey: jamming your photocopier one tray at a time.

entry.title: More stuff
entry.content:
I found the Lacuna Coil video, "Swamped", along with "Heaven's a Lie", available for download here. Hmm. I don't like the look of that sentence, even if this is even half true:


You are a GRAMMAR GOD!


If your mission in life is not already to
preserve the English tongue, it should be.
Congratulations and thank you!


How grammatically sound are you?
brought to you by Quizilla

I started reading "A Certain Chemistry". From the dedication and acknowledgements alone, it looks like a worthy followup to "Things My Girlfriend and I Have Argued About". Sample quote: "My academic career was indifferent to the point of beauty: I was so unremarkable, in every way, that the unvarying precision of my mediocrity achieved a kind of loveliness."

Other stuff on the web: trailers for Catwoman and Resident Evil: Apocalypse, and behind the scenes, topless women footage from Deuce Bigalow: European Gigolo (yeah, dumb humour, but who cares?)

entry.title: First post!
entry.content:
Why? Why not? The whole world seems to be blogging. All I need to do is find a nice client. clive is pretty nifty, but I'd prefer something graphical.

Headbanger's Ball with Slipknot is on. They played "No W" by Ministry. Damn! Now I'll have to get that album. Best of Ministry in one song! "Bad Blood" with dashes of "NWO", "Just One Fix", and "Psalm 69"! If I can only find out who that Sikth-sounding band who were on before Slayer were. Wow. Lacuna Coil. I love this show.
